author: Jen
title: Man ‘tried to abduct British toddler in Costa del Sol by promising her sweets’
text:
The scene of the incident in Estepona, Malaga (Picture: Solarpix.com) Police are investigating an attempted abduction of a British girl, 3, who was approached by a middle-aged man on the Costa del Sol. 
Her mum, 27, said the balding man was accompanied by a boy, who tried to strike up conversation with the toddler.
The older man is said to have offered her sweets to try to tempt her to leave with him as he grabbed her hand.
Described as ‘gypsy-looking’ by her mum, he was aged around 50 with a scar on his face.
Police are investigating, but have not yet made any arrests.

It happened last Tuesday at 3pm, while the mum-of-two was taking her daughter to a dance class in Estepnoa, a holiday resort, the Sun reports. 
When she saw it happen, the mum started to scream and grabbed her daughter to get him to let go.
She has now shared what happened on social media, urging parents to be aware.
‘He attempted to take my daughter,’ she said. ‘He uses a child to talk to the other children and then takes their hands and tries to take them.
‘Everyone with children or who knows someone with children should be very careful and not let your child out of your sight.
‘The police have been informed and are doing everything they can to find them.
‘The man has greying hair and a scar on the right side of his head.’
More follows.
